syllabus:
**Course Description**

This course aims to enhance teacher candidates’ competences in practicing mathematics teaching. A platform is provided for observation, plan, action, discussion and reflection on teaching mathematics in order to understand that teaching is inquiry-based and student-centered. Teacher candidates are furnished with teaching experience in a senior or junior high school, and learning experience from competent school teachers. This course not only helps teacher candidates become better teachers, but also guides them through a self-discovery path that leads to a lifelong commitment to study mathematics education.

The teacher candidates in IME have to take one credit additionally. The meeting hour is 13:20 to 14:10 every Thursday. That is, they will obtain 2+1 credits. In addition to the above in the regular classes, they are required to:

1.  All the teacher candidates take this course have to participate in two field observations and submit corresponding reports. Those in IME have to further observe at least two mathematics classes in IBDP schools and submit corresponding reports (App. 1).
2.  Participate in class activities, including class engagement, presentations, peer evaluations, and small-group and whole-class discussions.

1.  Conduct a micro teaching practice with the use of IBDP mathematics curriculum to peers (20 minutes).
2.  Submit a teaching plan and a reflective report before and after the micro teaching practice respectively (App. 2 & 3).
3.  Provide peer evaluation to the teacher candidates who is doing the micro teaching (App. 4-1, 4-2).
4.  Be one of the members to serve in one of the following activities for primary or secondary school students and submit a CAS report at the end of the semester: _Fun-math Camps_ of Shi-Da Institute for Mathematics Education (http://www.sdime.ntnu.edu.tw/page1/super\_pages.php?ID=page1&Sn=6), _Math Camps_ of the Department of Mathematics in NTNU ([http://www.math.ntnu.edu.tw/~mathcamp/](http://www.math.ntnu.edu.tw/~mathcamp/)), _Sciences Camps_ of Yuan T. **Regular course**

**Topic:** Real mathematics teaching context

*   Strategies for teaching, learning, and assessments
*   Real mathematics teaching and learning situations in the context of local schools

**Activities:**
